title: [K-12] Organic Chemistry Foundational Competency Enhancement Program

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational general chemistry knowledge (atomic structure, chemical bonding, intermolecular interactions)
context.additional_context: Program for non-majors to systematically master core organic chemistry concepts, combining online theory with offline lab sessions and emphasizing structural similarities and conceptual connections

learning_goals: Learners can observe functional similarities in molecular structures and classify them with 80% accuracy
Learners can explain and diagram reaction mechanisms of organic compounds in three or more steps
Learners can analyze how molecular structural differences affect reactivity with 70%+ explanatory power
Learners can infer functional groups by interpreting IR/UV spectral data
Learners can explain acid-base reactions in relation to pKa values
Learners can predict stereochemical configurations of reaction products by applying stereochemical concepts
Learners can comparatively analyze how reaction conditions (temperature, solvent) influence reaction pathways
Learners can design organic synthesis routes as logical workflows of three or more steps
Learners can critically evaluate reaction mechanisms based on experimental results.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
